history.text: Hi, have you seen the Notebook yet?
I have, it tugged at my heart quite a bit. How about you?
Yes it I cried when I watched it, Nicholas Sparks usually does that pretty well.
I enjoy Ryan Gosling and Rachel McAdams acting in this movie.
Yes, all of his books are pretty spectacular but this one especially so.
Some people call it over the top, but I very much liked the plot and thought it fit well
I don't think it was too over the top, it was believable
Nick Cassavetes did a great job on directing, I never read the book though.
Agreed, You would think that this was an entirely plausible thing to happen in real life
I haven't read the book either, but I heard that it earned some awards
Not unlike the movie
The ratings though on this movie can be seen as misleading if you are a big fan of the romance genre
I believe that, I don't know if you ever saw Mean Girls but it's amazing how well she acted compared to how she acted in that movie
I love how the movie is kind of centered around the house he remodels because of her.
Yes I have, quite a different part to play for the actress for sure
Although I couldn't believe how her parent's treated him, it's amazing how much money and class had to do with people's relationships back then
Yes and it all began after that fateful trip to the carnival that one night
Yes, I had almost forgotten about the carnival.
True. Parenting was so different back then, banning offspring from seeing other people
It's so touching when he starts writing the love letters
I found it despicable that her mother hid all those letters from her, things would have been so different.
Yeah totally gave him the wrong impression. Still he goes and buys that house they were in anyways
Yes he does, he looked past what her parents thought of him in the end.
Even after seeing her kiss someone else
I'm glad she didn't stay with the man she was to marry, I think she would have been unhappy all her life, like her mother
Most definitely. She reunites with Noah, and sparks start flying
It's like falling in love all over again
The sparks fly right away!
I think her mother felt guilty in the end because she was still in love with the man she couldn't be with
At the end of the day, she puts money aside, tells her fiance she is in love with Noah, and goes back to her true love
He let her go pretty easily, I was afraid that there would be more drama involved with that
That's a good point. I'm glad it was resolved as easily as it did though
You can tell they were definitely not meant for each other, Lon and Allie
Great performance from the actors'actresses to convey that
No they weren't, they had many different interests and it seems that he didn't put her first like Noah did
Yes, everyone did such a great job acting in this film
Yeah Noah was all for her and that shows true dedication
Something that is hard to find in life today. That's why i think the movie has such broad appeal
